summary: The Air Traffic Controller Protection Act (H.R. 2751) aims to protect the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) workforce. It requires the Secretary of Transportation to obtain explicit Congressional approval before reducing, replacing, or outsourcing 1% or more of the FAA workforce.  The bill also mandates a report to Congress detailing the rationale and impact of such decisions.  Furthermore, it prohibits the privatization or outsourcing of the FAA's air traffic control system.
